paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the BRCA2 variant IVS16-2A>G, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: In BRCA2 IVS16-2A>G families we found a breast cancer incidence of 24.6% (15/61).

functional_data.summary: The IVS16-2A>G mutation is a splice site mutation found frequently in Slovenian breast cancer families.

variants.segregation_data: Yes, it segregates with disease in families.
variants.additional_notes: The penetrance of ovarian cancer is much lower in IVS16-2A>G BRCA2 families than in BRCA1 families.
key_quotes: The IVS16-2A>G in the BRCA2 gene appears to be a unique founder mutation in the Slovenian population.
In BRCA2 IVS16-2A>G families we found a breast cancer incidence of 24.6% (15/61).

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted all relevant data for the BRCA2 variant IVS16-2A>G.
